result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony John Aldrich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the Wisconsin State Prison System

superMiscConds.notes: The conditions of Extended Supervision are the same as the conditions of probation.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. Defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
On any vehicle titled in the defendant's name or driven by the defendant

miscConds.notes: Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

Pay fine in the amount of $2,400.00 - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.
Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Cash bail on deposit to apply. Pay the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.
Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
Court ordered defendant is not to drive any motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

timeConds.notes: First 6 months are to be served straight time.  As to the remaining 6 months, Court allows release privileges for employment, treatment, and any other programming that will assist the defendant with his rehabilitation.  Court ordered GOOD TIME CREDIT with the condition time. (DEFENDANT REMANDED INTO CUSTODY WITH THE SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT IN COURT).

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony John Aldrich

Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony John Aldrich in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:         Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS, with credit for 5 DAYS time served.
INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program. 

The court stayed the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3 YEARS under the supervision of Wisconsin Department of Corrections with the following conditions:

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* SERVE 12 MONTHS "condition time".  First 6 months are to be served straight time.  As to the remaining 6 months, Court allows release privileges for employment, treatment, and any other programming that will assist the defendant with his rehabilitation.  Court ordered GOOD TIME CREDIT with the condition time.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY fine in the amount of $2,400.00 - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Defendant's driver operating privileges are revoked for 2 years.
* Defendant is not to drive any motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
* Any vehicle titled in the defendant's name or driven by the defendant is to have an ignition interlock device installed for a period of 30 months.
* The conditions of extended supervision are the same as the conditions of probation.

  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

  (DEFENDANT REMANDED INTO CUSTODY WITH THE SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT IN COURT)

Received and filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.
Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan.
Defendant's Blood Toxicology Report.

Defendant Anthony John Aldrich in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form tendered to the Court.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY "as charged". Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form.

Defendant Anthony John Aldrich in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  Jacob Corr for Catelin Autumn Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
